results.title: A New look at Leeuwenhoek's wee beasties
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of the Series “Inhabitants of the planet earth”
Examines free-living protists as viewed in natural time by differential interference cinemicrography. Discusses the classification and general characteristics of flagellates, amoebas, and ciliates.

results.title: A New dress (35 years of family sewing)
results.brief_description:
Bev Scott has been making clothes for her family for thirty years. To the sporadic background sound of a sewing machine, family members are interviewed showing their home-made clothes to describe the woman who created them.
Filmed by Malcolm McKinnon and featuring Bev Scott, Heather Scott, Robyn Ritchie, Erin Ritchie and Lauren Ritchie. Made in collaboration with Showcase Wangaratta.

results.title: A New Deal?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
About 10000 people around the world die every day from lack of food. Are we really heading for global disaster? What can the world do to help itself? This and other questions about world poverty are discussed

results.title: A new day in Samoa
results.brief_description: The people of Western Samoa and their progress toward self-government. The pattern of village life, growing cash crops, Apia the capital and chief port, parades, Robert Louis Stevenson’s grave, building new churches, the work of health sisters, education, internal self government, New Zealand administration and economic assistance, the combination of British and Samoan tradition.

results.title: A New art in cooking
results.creator_credit: Jerry Warner and Lawry's Food Inc
results.brief_description: Every woman, no matter why her culinary talents, can produce unique and exciting cooking masterpieces in her own kitchen through the artistry of seasoning blends/ Employing works of master painters to introduce this concept, the film demonstrates the ease with which readily available seasoning ingredients can be used to add zest and variety to every meal. In addition, imaginative table settings provide new ideas.

results.title: A New approach to dental health
results.brief_description: Shows a multidisciplinary approach to the teaching of dental care in some English schools. Illustrates how reading, writing, mathematical and social skills, as well as knowledge of dental care, can be developed with this approach. Also notes parents’ reactions to this style of teaching.

results.title: A Natural question
results.creator_credit: Central Electricity Generating Board Film Unit and Stan Gomm
results.brief_description: Deals with the liaison between the sponsor and nature conservationists; showing some of the special nature trails they have set up for children in industrialised areas and describing other ways in which they are contributing towards nature conservancy. Presented by Phil Drabble with Art Direction by Richard Piper.

results.title: A Natural history of a psychotic illness in childhood
results.brief_description: Documented case from infancy onward. A chain of accidental circumstances provide a unique opportunity to obtain a visualised record of the gradual unfolding of the psychotic process in childhood. Contains material from three excellent sources, a family album of still photographs that tell the change in a series of static steps, a motion picture, filling in the gap between the stills with greater dynamic effect and a detailed and strangely objective diary kept by the mother. Research directed by James Anthony.
